item.title: Elisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description:
"Atticus sat looking at the floor for a long time. Finally he raised his head. “Scout,” he said, “Mr. Ewell fell on his knife. Can you possibly understand?”
Atticus looked like he needed cheering up. I ran to him and hugged him and kissed him with all my might. “Yes sir, I understand,” I reassured him. “Mr. Tate was right.”
Atticus disengaged himself and looked at me. “What do you mean?”
“Well, it’d be sort of like shootin’ a mockingbird, wouldn’t it?”
Atticus put his face in my hair and rubbed it. When he got up and walked across the porch into the shadows, his youthful step had returned. Before he went inside the house, he stopped in front of Boo Radley. “Thank you for my children, Arthur.” he said." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "She seemed glad to see me when I appeared in the kitchen, and by watching her I began to think there was some skill involved in being a girl." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "As a reader I loathe introductions...Introductions inhibit pleasure, they kill the joy of anticipation, they frustrate curiosity." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "The remainder of my schooldays were no more auspicious than the first. Indeed, they were an endless Project that slowly evolved into a Unit, in which miles of construction paper and wax crayon were expended by the State of Alabama in its well-meaning but fruitless efforts to teach me Group Dynamics." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I said I would like it very much, which was a lie, but one must lie under certain circumstances and at all times when one can't do anything about them." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "Who we are in the present includes who we were in the past." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "The connections we make in the course of a life--maybe that's what heaven is." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "I hope you're proud of yourself for the times you've said "yes," when all it meant was extra work for you and was seemingly helpful only to someone else." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "The greatest gift you ever give is your honest self." -- Fred Rogers
